Text:
There are almost no vampires left in the Crimson
Tower.

That said, there are still some, and every now and
again, the two of them find themselves under attack.
Now! Through the heart!
I know!

Following Mary's instructions, Claire impales the
headless vampire's heart.

Even so-called immortal vampires die if their hearts
get destroyed. And they can't stand sunlight, right?
As a vampire hunter, you really know your stuff.
Let's hurry ahead.

It's thanks to Mary's help that the two of them have
made it through unscathed.

Although she has less raw magic at her disposal than
Claire, her mastery with the sword is downright
impressive. And more important, she's used to
fighting vampires.

Most vampires rely on physical strength in battle,
and it's easy to imagine how difficult it would be to
go against an opponent with such superhuman movements
and astounding regenerative skills in a fair fight.

However, Mary seems to know what the vampires
are going to do before they do it, and her responses
are swift and precise.

Having her help is going to be essential in rescuing
her brother. Claire knows that full well.
Yet even so—she just can't help but say something.
You're hiding something from me.
What do you mean, "something"?

You were acting strangely back at the library. It was
like you were on the vampires' side. What's your aim?
The Blood Queen.
To hunt her down, right?
...I've dedicated my entire life to that cause.

What was up with that exchange back at the library,
then? What is this "Haven"?

You don't look like an elf, so why did she say you've
been hunting them for a thousand years?
Claire.

I can say the same for you. There's no way to heal
the possessed.

So why did you ask such an obvious question when
everyone knows the answer?
Everyone has their secrets. Don't they?

I won't pry if you don't either. How about we just
leave it at that?
What...?!
What the—?!
That's some powerful magic...
The two tread silently as they ascend the tower.
Aaag...ghh...

Looks like vampires really do die when their hearts
get destroyed. What a weakling, though... Wasn't he
one of the top brass?
Oh well... Plenty more to take his place.
*gasp*
Now, where's this...Blood Queen of yours?
That's...
You know him?
Juggernaut the Tyrant...
Isn't he the ruler of the Black Tower?

That vampire he just killed was the third strongest
in this tower.
And the one crushed on the floor?

The one on the left is the fifth strongest, and the
one on the right gets an honorary mention.
I guess it's just their titles that are impressive...

Juggernaut is a man who climbed the ranks and became
one of the ulimate forces in the Lawless City through
sheer brute violence.
We should try to avoid fighting him.
I agree. Let's leave before he notices us...
My instinct's always right...
Hey bloodsucker, I'll put your ass in the ground.
Juggernaut's fist sinks into Claire's face.
Claire?!
Where do you think...
...you're looking?!
Agh!

I thought you were better than these scum...but maybe
my instinct was wrong...
Huh?
Hahahahah!

You're tougher than I thought. Most would've been
finished after taking one of those hits.

You're only the second person who's ever managed to
punch me in the face.
Well, what an honor!
Mary, are you okay—?!
No! This can't be...
The wound has reached Mary's organs. It's fatal.
Mary! Hang in there, Mary!
Mary! I'll patch you up now—

Claire puts her hand on the wound and runs magic
through it. When she does, though, Mary grabs it.
Don't worry... It's just been a while...so...
Mary?
Please, Claire...
Let me suck your blood...

Mary sucks on Claire's lips, slurping up the blood
dripping off them.
//ムービー再生
Rgh... I'm not used...to the blood yet...

While Claire is distracted by Mary, the Tyrant
appears before her and raises his billhook high.
Forgive me... Cid...

In her final moments, the only thing Claire thinks of
is her brother. But then—

A man wearing a jet-black longcoat swoops in between
Claire and the Tyrant.
...Huh?
Ooof?!

With astonishing speed, the man casually kicks the
Tyrant off the castle.
The hell's your problem, Shaaaadow—!
*gasp*
Shadow...

Under normal circumstances, his overwhelming power
might have caused her to put her guard up. But now,
for whatever reason, seeing him sets her heart at
ease.

Why is he inspiring such emotions in her, even though
they've never met before? Claire doesn't know. She
can't tear her eyes off him.

The rampage has begun... There isn't much time
left...
Suddenly, he vanishes.
The time of awakening is nigh...

Shadow... I hear the Church considers him their
enemy...
Did he save us?
He took out the Tyrant in just one hit...
Mary, are you okay?

Probably... Sorry about that, Claire. For sucking
your blood...
It's okay—I mean, it's totally not okay, but...
Anyway, Mary, is the thing you were hiding from me—
Yes, I'm a vampire...

I'll tell you everything—who I am, my motives,
and the truth behind the Blood Queen...
And with sadness in her eyes, Mary begins her tale.
